intro: Mammea timorensis, commonly known as the Timor mammea, is a tropical tree native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, red-orange flowers. The plant produces woody, spiny capsules that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
